uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.networkanalysis

Class Decision

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.networkanalysis.Decision

  • public class Decision
extends java.lang.Object

    Decision

    Based on the Link Analysis, make a decision as to whether or not the request user is able to authenticate with the system. Returning a True (yes, they can authenticate) or False (no, they cannot authenticate) result decide().

    This class is intended as the main interface of the package while other classes are mainly utility class that are not designed to be used outside the scope of this project. This class uses those utility classes in order to make a decision.

    Currently set-up for Twitter but could be changed to accommodate both Twitter and Facebook.

    Author:
    Jonathan Carlton

    • Constructor Detail

      • Decision

        public Decision(long requestingUser,
                java.util.List<java.lang.Long> staticUsers,
                java.util.Date lastChecked)
        Object constructor.

        Need to provide a requesting user id and a list of the static user id's that form the keys of the network.

        Parameters:
        requestingUser - the user attempting to authenticate
        staticUsers - a list of user ids
        lastChecked - the last time the user was checked

      • Decision

        public Decision(long ru,
                java.util.List<java.lang.Long> su,
                java.util.Date lc,
                java.lang.String ck,
                java.lang.String sk,
                java.lang.String at,
                java.lang.String ats)
        Object constructor whereby the API Keys are supplied.
        Parameters:
        ru - the requesting user.
        su - the list of static users.
        lc - the date that the requesting user was last checked.
        ck - the consumer key (Twitter4J).
        sk - the secret key (Twitter4J).
        at - the access token (Twitter4J).
        ats - the access token secret (Twitter4J).

      • Decision

        Object constructor to be used when you already have an authenticated instance of the Twitter4J Twitter API.
        Parameters:
        ru - the requesting user.
        su - the list of static users.
        lc - the last time the requesting user was checked
        twitter - the authenticated Twitter (Twitter4J) instance.

        ats - the access token secret (Twitter4J).
        mlApiKey - the Monkey Learn API key.
